course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Business Simulation and Strategic Decisions
course.description: This course combines case discussions to illustrate strategic decision making in business with an integrated hands-on business simulation exercise as part of the learning process. The course may be taught blended-learning with online discussions and meetings, or in a traditional face to face mode. Topics include making strategic choices and evaluating options and tradeoffs in a competitive business simulated industry environment.

reviews.author: nek
reviews.title: Business Simulation?
reviews.comment_content:
The previous code for this course is ISOM 3100. You may refer to ISOM 3100 for more reviews.
The course mainly uses the online platform "Capstone" to do business stimulation. You have to study the user manual and rules. The professor will share what companies should do when facing trade-offs.
It is a blended learning course, so you have to watch some online videos (30 min - 1 hr) and attend 1 lesson (2 hours) each week.

It is true that some techniques or concepts about how to master the stimulation can be applied in different industries. However, I am still feeling like the course content is "紙上談兵", not really linked to the real business world.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor and TA are knowledgeable on the topics and they will share their advice on our simulation.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lecture Video and Online Quizzes - 10%
Participation [Personal Investment Performance + contributions to class discussions, peer evaluation] - 20%
Individual Business simulation - 10%
Group Business simulation - 40%
Comprehensive Review Assessment - 20%
----------
50% of the course is about "playing" the Capstone simulation, it is not easy to understand how it works in the beginning. But once you know the skills and techniques, it is not difficult to get a good outcome in the simulation.
The class size is small (~10 people), only 3 groups are formed for the group simulation. Even you make some mistakes at the beginning, the professor and TA will guide you back to the right track. As a result, all groups get a good outcome. So the grade mainly depends on your final assessment.
The score for the final assessment is not released.
But due to the small class size, it is not easy to get A range.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload. Spend about an hour to discuss the strategy with your groupmate each week for the group simulation.

The comprehensive assessment (final exam) is open book, open internet.
